results.title: Fire of time
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Urban development in Barcelona has all but destroyed the once vibrant Barrio Chino where the nights were days and the days were long. This is an evocative film shot through windows, on street corners and in small rooms. People, clouds, and the swift tail lights of cars glide past and through, as fleeting traces of the passage of time. And as this one working-class Red Light district is transformed and changed by the process of gentrification, the former residents appear as ghosts, their prescence - as graffiti, as shadows - a reminder of the real history of the city. Larger forces cause buildings and neighbourhoods to vanish but they are rebuilt again in memories, worn photographs and in light. Adam Cohen’s handling of light gives people the substance of phantoms and their passages through the half deserted streets evoke Eliot, Proust, and Chris Marker. Sounds of this world are orchestrated with cello, organ and guitar to form a profoundly beautiful work about memory, longing and loss.

results.title: Fishtank
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
A high-rise flat in the U.K. Midlands. Ray is the father who drinks, Liz the mother, Jason the brother. There are some animals and the brother kills flies. The older brother films them with his handycam - intently observing whatever is going on.

In 1996 Richard Billingham’s ‘Ray’s a Laugh’ was hailed as the photo book of the decade. His photographs were one of the talking points of ‘Sensation’. Billingham has now made ‘Fishtank’, a commission for television by Artangel in collaboration with film-maker Adam Curtis and Illuminations TV for BBC2’s acclaimed TV series. The ‘video verite’ of Fishtank is contained within the compressed space/fishtank of the flat. Sometimes they talk, sometimes they argue. Billingham’s film registers the emotional temperature of this space and the family who live there with a closeness that transcends camera conventions. Like the paintings of Lucian Freud, Billingham crafts a terrible beauty from the landscape of family life and its patterns of pathos, despair and hope.

results.title: Green Fingers: Looking After Lemons
results.brief_description:
‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Looking After Lemons’, gardener Rod Cantrill shows ways to look after the popular lemon tree.

The narrator points out various issues that can afflict them including collar rot, leaf yellowing, leaf fall, and pests and diseases, while Cantrill works on lemon trees in a beautiful orchard. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: Green Fingers: Pest and Disease Control
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: this is an archival film and contemporary advice should be sought when handling chemicals and poisons.

‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Pest and Disease Control’, Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to use agricultural sprays on a rose garden at Burnley Gardens.

Diseases described include black spot, aphids and powdery mildew. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: Green Fingers: Indoor Plants
results.brief_description:
‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Indoor Plants’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to propagate and look after indoor plants.

The film contains wonderful footage of the glasshouses at Burnley Horticultural College, with plants shown including rubber plants, philodendron and rex begonias. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: Play It Again II: Games Collection
results.brief_description:
The Play It Again II project aims to document, preserve, and create an accessible and playable history of Australasian videogames and videogame culture from the 1990’s.

This collection comprises physical games and hardware donated to ACMI for the project and as well as game emulation files created by ACMI or harvested from external web repositories.

The project is being undertaken by ACMI in partnership with Flinders University, University of Melbourne, The New Zealand Film Archive, Berlin Computerspiele Museum, and the Research Trust of Victoria University of Wellington. Funding comes from the Australian Research Council (ARC) Linkage Projects scheme, which funds collaborative projects between University researchers and Partner Organisations. Play It Again II is a continuation of Play It Again I, which focused on preserving Australasian videogames from the 1980’s.

results.title: Shadowrun [SNES]
results.creator_credit: Data East USA and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cartidge videogame. Cartridge, reference sheet and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
The world of Shadowrun is defined by the Awakening, where magic has been re-discovered, and human beings have accepted the existence of those they thought to be fantasy creatures. Mega-corporations and cyberworlds now share the world with elves and Native American shamans.

The player is Jake Armitage, a seemingly ordinary data courier who is assassinated by a hit squad in the year 2050 in Seattle, Washington. A mysterious figure rushes to Jake and cast a spell on him and he wakes up in the morgue with complete memory loss. Jake must now begin to unravel the mystery of his death and miraculous resurrection.

The game is a skill-based role playing game (RPG) with action-oriented combat. The player can use firearms and learn magic spells, primarily with defensive and support capabilities. The game was a critical success, winning a number of industry awards, but was a commercial failure nevertheless. It was retrospectively acclaimed by several publications as an “ahead of its time” milestone in the history of the role-playing genre for the consoles and credited for having pioneered film noir style in video games.

results.title: Powerslide [PC]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM in CD jewel case with insert and manual
results.brief_description: After an environmental holocaust killed 98% of the worldâ€™s population, the survivors above ground turned to modifying and racing the cars left over in the ruins of civilization. In the ruined world of Powerslide, players race through abandoned cities buried in sand, ruins of a dam, abandoned mine shafts, and other desolate landscapes. Perform death-defying jumps and slide through the corners as you eke out each win! This racing sim has full car dynamics, force feedback, and full multiplayer support.

results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. One 3 1/2 inch floppy disk and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Explore Australia and help solve a plethora of mysteries in Gumboots Australia. In this this adventure and educational game, the player is tasked with solving cases as an investigator for the Gumboots Enquiry Agency, a job that will take the player all over the country. The player will get to visit locations as varied as Kakadu to Coober Pedy in their hunt for the next clue. Getting there is its own challenge, as different modes of transportation can cost time and money. Random events along the way aid or hinder the playerâ€™s quest to solve the case.

results.title: Flight of the Amazon Queen [DOS]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert, manual, registration card and installation guide in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Flight of the Amazon Queen is a point and click adventure where you play Joe King as he uses his plane, the Amazon Queen, to fly famous actress Faye Russell to a film shoot. When the plane crash lands in a remote jungle, and he must use his wits to battle his way out of the dangers he faces.

As with many point and click adventures, a set of icons at the bottom of the screen allows the player to interact with other characters or the environment. The game has since been ported to smartphones, with the addition of improved graphics, full voice acting, multi-language support and a play through of the interactive interview mini-game with audio commentary by John Passfield, one of the gameâ€™s designers.
